structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Conclusiveness Of Consent Judgment In Automobile Case
law.text: In an action to recover damages for injuries to person or property, or for death, or consequential damages, so called, sustained by reason of a motor vehicle accident, a judgment entered by agreement of the parties, without a hearing on the merits, shall not operate as a bar to an action brought by a defendant in the action in which such judgment was entered, unless such agreement was signed by the defendant in person.
